Name: Dropdown Menu
Description: Displays a menu to the user—such as a set of actions or functions—triggered by a button.

SubComponents.Name: Root
SubComponents.Description: Contains all the parts of a dropdown menu.

Props.Name: defaultOpen
Props.Description: The open state of the dropdown menu when it is initially rendered. Use when you do not need to control its open state.

Props.Name: open
Props.Description: The controlled open state of the dropdown menu. Must be used in conjunction with onOpenChange.

Props.Name: onOpenChange
Props.Description: Event handler called when the open state of the dropdown menu changes.

Props.Name: modal
Props.Description: Event handler called when the open state of the dropdown menu changes.

Props.Name: dir
Props.Description: The reading direction of submenus when applicable. If omitted, inherits globally from DirectionProvider or assumes LTR (left-to-right) reading mode.

SubComponents.Name: Trigger
SubComponents.Description: The button that toggles the dropdown menu. By default, the DropdownMenu.Content will position itself against the trigger.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: The reading direction of submenus when applicable. If omitted, inherits globally from DirectionProvider or assumes LTR (left-to-right) reading mode.

SubComponents.Name: Portal
SubComponents.Description: When used, portals the content part into the body.

Props.Name: forceMount
Props.Description: Used to force mounting when more control is needed. Useful when controlling animation with React animation libraries. If used on this part, it will be inherited by DropdownMenu.Content and DropdownMenu.SubContent respectively.

Props.Name: container
Props.Description: Specify a container element to portal the content into.

SubComponents.Name: Content
SubComponents.Description: The component that pops out when the dropdown menu is open.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

Props.Name: loop
Props.Description: When true, keyboard navigation will loop from last item to first, and vice versa.

Props.Name: onCloseAutoFocus
Props.Description: Event handler called when focus moves to the trigger after closing. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

Props.Name: onEscapeKeyDown
Props.Description: Event handler called when focus moves to the trigger after closing. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

Props.Name: onPointerDownOutside
Props.Description: Event handler called when the escape key is down. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault

Props.Name: onFocusOutside
Props.Description: Event handler called when a pointer event occurs outside the bounds of the component. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

Props.Name: onInteractOutside
Props.Description: Event handler called when focus moves outside the bounds of the component. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

Props.Name: forceMount
Props.Description: Event handler called when an interaction (pointer or focus event) happens outside the bounds of the component. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

Props.Name: side
Props.Description: The preferred side of the trigger to render against when open. Will be reversed when collisions occur and avoidCollisions is enabled.

Props.Name: sideOffset
Props.Description: The preferred side of the trigger to render against when open. Will be reversed when collisions occur and avoidCollisions is enabled.

Props.Name: align
Props.Description: The preferred alignment against the trigger. May change when collisions occur.

Props.Name: alignOffset
Props.Description: The preferred alignment against the trigger. May change when collisions occur.

Props.Name: avoidCollisions
Props.Description: When true, overrides the side andalign preferences to prevent collisions with boundary edges.

Props.Name: collisionBoundary
Props.Description: The element used as the collision boundary. By default this is the viewport, though you can provide additional element(s) to be included in this check.

Props.Name: collisionPadding
Props.Description: The distance in pixels from the boundary edges where collision detection should occur. Accepts a number (same for all sides), or a partial padding object, for example: { top: 20, left: 20 }.

Props.Name: arrowPadding
Props.Description: The padding between the arrow and the edges of the content. If your content has border-radius, this will prevent it from overflowing the corners.

Props.Name: sticky
Props.Description: The sticky behavior on the align axis. "partial" will keep the content in the boundary as long as the trigger is at least partially in the boundary whilst "always" will keep the content in the boundary regardless.

Props.Name: hideWhenDetached
Props.Description: The sticky behavior on the align axis. "partial" will keep the content in the boundary as long as the trigger is at least partially in the boundary whilst "always" will keep the content in the boundary regardless.

SubComponents.Name: Arrow
SubComponents.Description: An optional arrow element to render alongside the dropdown menu. This can be used to help visually link the trigger with the DropdownMenu.Content. Must be rendered inside DropdownMenu.Content.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

Props.Name: width
Props.Description: The width of the arrow in pixels.

Props.Name: height
Props.Description: The height of the arrow in pixels.

SubComponents.Name: Item
SubComponents.Description: The component that contains the dropdown menu items.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

Props.Name: disabled
Props.Description: When true, prevents the user from interacting with the item.

Props.Name: onSelect
Props.Description: Event handler called when the user selects an item (via mouse or keyboard). Calling event.preventDefault in this handler will prevent the dropdown menu from closing when selecting that item.

Props.Name: textValue
Props.Description: Event handler called when the user selects an item (via mouse or keyboard). Calling event.preventDefault in this handler will prevent the dropdown menu from closing when selecting that item.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

SubComponents.Name: Label
SubComponents.Description: Used to render a label. It won't be focusable using arrow keys.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

SubComponents.Name: CheckboxItem
SubComponents.Description: An item that can be controlled and rendered like a checkbox.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

Props.Name: checked
Props.Description: The controlled checked state of the item. Must be used in conjunction with onCheckedChange.

Props.Name: onCheckedChange
Props.Description: Event handler called when the checked state changes.

Props.Name: disabled
Props.Description: Event handler called when the checked state changes.

Props.Name: onSelect
Props.Description: Event handler called when the user selects an item (via mouse or keyboard). Calling event.preventDefault in this handler will prevent the dropdown menu from closing when selecting that item.

Props.Name: textValue
Props.Description: Event handler called when the user selects an item (via mouse or keyboard). Calling event.preventDefault in this handler will prevent the dropdown menu from closing when selecting that item.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

Props.Name: value
Props.Description: The value of the selected item in the group.

Props.Name: onValueChange
Props.Description: Event handler called when the value changes.

SubComponents.Name: RadioItem
SubComponents.Description: An item that can be controlled and rendered like a radio.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Event handler called when the value changes.

Props.Name: value
Props.Description: The unique value of the item.

Props.Name: disabled
Props.Description: When true, prevents the user from interacting with the item.

Props.Name: onSelect
Props.Description: Event handler called when the user selects an item (via mouse or keyboard). Calling event.preventDefault in this handler will prevent the dropdown menu from closing when selecting that item.

Props.Name: textValue
Props.Description: Event handler called when the user selects an item (via mouse or keyboard). Calling event.preventDefault in this handler will prevent the dropdown menu from closing when selecting that item.

SubComponents.Name: ItemIndicator
SubComponents.Description: Renders when the parent DropdownMenu.CheckboxItem or DropdownMenu.RadioItem is checked. You can style this element directly, or you can use it as a wrapper to put an icon into, or both.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

Props.Name: forceMount
Props.Description: Used to force mounting when more control is needed. Useful when controlling animation with React animation libraries.

SubComponents.Name: Separator
SubComponents.Description: Used to visually separate items in the dropdown menu.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

SubComponents.Name: Sub
SubComponents.Description: Contains all the parts of a submenu.

Props.Name: defaultOpen
Props.Description: The open state of the submenu when it is initially rendered. Use when you do not need to control its open state.

Props.Name: open
Props.Description: The controlled open state of the submenu. Must be used in conjunction with onOpenChange.

Props.Name: onOpenChange
Props.Description: Event handler called when the open state of the submenu changes.

SubComponents.Name: SubTrigger
SubComponents.Description: An item that opens a submenu. Must be rendered inside DropdownMenu.Sub.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Event handler called when the open state of the submenu changes.

Props.Name: disabled
Props.Description: When true, prevents the user from interacting with the item.

Props.Name: textValue
Props.Description: Optional text used for typeahead purposes. By default the typeahead behavior will use the .textContent of the item. Use this when the content is complex, or you have non-textual content inside.

SubComponents.Name: SubContent
SubComponents.Description: The component that pops out when a submenu is open. Must be rendered inside DropdownMenu.Sub.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

Props.Name: loop
Props.Description: When true, keyboard navigation will loop from last item to first, and vice versa.

Props.Name: onEscapeKeyDown
Props.Description: Event handler called when the escape key is down. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault

Props.Name: onPointerDownOutside
Props.Description: Event handler called when the escape key is down. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault

Props.Name: onFocusOutside
Props.Description: Event handler called when a pointer event occurs outside the bounds of the component. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

Props.Name: onInteractOutside
Props.Description: Event handler called when focus moves outside the bounds of the component. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

Props.Name: forceMount
Props.Description: Event handler called when an interaction (pointer or focus event) happens outside the bounds of the component. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault.

Props.Name: sideOffset
Props.Description: The distance in pixels from the trigger.

Props.Name: alignOffset
Props.Description: An offset in pixels from the "start" or "end" alignment options.

Props.Name: avoidCollisions
Props.Description: When true, overrides the side andalign preferences to prevent collisions with boundary edges.

Props.Name: collisionBoundary
Props.Description: The element used as the collision boundary. By default this is the viewport, though you can provide additional element(s) to be included in this check.

Props.Name: collisionPadding
Props.Description: The distance in pixels from the boundary edges where collision detection should occur. Accepts a number (same for all sides), or a partial padding object, for example: { top: 20, left: 20 }.

Props.Name: arrowPadding
Props.Description: The padding between the arrow and the edges of the content. If your content has border-radius, this will prevent it from overflowing the corners.

Props.Name: sticky
Props.Description: The sticky behavior on the align axis. "partial" will keep the content in the boundary as long as the trigger is at least partially in the boundary whilst "always" will keep the content in the boundary regardless.

Props.Name: hideWhenDetached
Props.Description: The sticky behavior on the align axis. "partial" will keep the content in the boundary as long as the trigger is at least partially in the boundary whilst "always" will keep the content in the boundary regardless.
